706083f-a.text:
153 Nostrand Ave., at the N.E. corner of Vernon Ave., showing the Vander.
veer house, erected by Henry Boerum in 1866.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706083f-a.folder: Nostrand Avenue & Vernon Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706081f-b.text:
(1)
Nostrand Ave., at the N.E. corner of Vernon Ave. A view of the Wanderveer House, built in 1868, raned in September 1928. A 5-story
Apartment house now (1936) occupies the site.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Arbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, from another angle.
May 1923.
EugmaeoL. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, another view.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same, showing the east side of Vernon Ave.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706082f-a.text:
153 Nostrand Ave., at the N.E. corner of Vernon Ave., showing a section of the old Rappelyea farm, purchased by Henry Boerum on May 1, 1828 and who, in 1866, erected for his daughter Mrs. Susan Vanderveer, the home in this view. When it was in existence it was known as the Vanderveer house; now
(1929)a 5-story apartment house occupies the site.
1922.
Eugene 1. Armbruster Collection.
706082f-a.folder: Nostrand Avenue & Vernon Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
